openpas.basics

Interface PAS


  • public interface PAS
    This is a class that encapsulates a PAS instance. It's essentially a convenience container class that supports many string parsing and consistency checking functions. It's a good high-level interface to using OpenPAS as it distills and offers the needed functionality from any various other classes into this single interface. It's possible to do all the PAS related calculations without using the PAS class. The special literals True and False are implicitly defined in any PAS instance (and so won't be accepted as user-defined literals), but they are not returned by the get* functions.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  PAS.KBException
      This is the error reporting mechanism for PAS.

    • Method Detail

      • getKB

        Expressions.SimpleSentence<LogicalOps.LogicalAnd,LogicalOps.LogicalOr> getKB()
        Returns the embedded knowledgebase (KB) for the PAS instance. This KB should not be externally modified once inside a PAS instance.
        Returns:

      • getAssumptions

        java.lang.Iterable<Assumption> getAssumptions()
        Returns the assumptions contained in this PAS instance. It will return a positive and negated instance of each and every assumption known.
        Returns:

      • getAssumptions

        java.lang.Iterable<Assumption> getAssumptions(boolean positive)
        Returns the assumptions contained in this PAS instance same as getAssumptions(). But also takes a parameter to specify whether the positive or negated versions of the assumptions are required only.
        Parameters:
        positive -
        Returns:

                         boolean positive)
        Returns the named assumption if it exists in this PAS instance.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        Will return an assumption or null if there's not any.

      • getPropositions

        java.lang.Iterable<Proposition> getPropositions()
        Returns the propositions contained in this PAS instance. It will return a positive and negated instance of each and every proposition known.

        Proposition getProposition(java.lang.String name,
                           boolean positive)
        Returns the named proposition if it exists in this PAS instance.
        Parameters:
        name -
        Returns:
        Will return a proposition or null if there's not any.

      • createProposition

        Proposition createProposition(java.lang.String name,
                              boolean neg)
                       throws PAS.KBException
        Create a proposition with the given name and negation.
        Parameters:
        name - A unique name (inside this PAS instance).
        neg - true if the returned proposition instance is to be negated, false otherwise. Both the negated and positive versions of the proposition will exist in the PAS instance regardless once the proposition is created.
        Returns:
        The newly created proposition. If the named proposition already exists in this PAS instance, it should be returned.
        Throws:
        PAS.KBException - If the specified name exists as a literal type other than proposition, this method will throw.

      • createAssumption

        Assumption createAssumption(java.lang.String name,
                            boolean neg,
                            double probability)
                     throws PAS.KBException
        Create an assumption with the given name, probability, and negation.
        Parameters:
        name - A unique name (inside this PAS instance).
        neg - true if the returned assumption instance is to be negated, false otherwise. Both the negated and positive versions of the assumption will exist in the PAS instance regardless once the assumption is created.
        probability - A value x \in [0,1] that's the probability of the desired assumption.
        Returns:
        The newly created assumption if created, or if an assumption exactly matching this exists, the existing assumption.
        Throws:
        PAS.KBException - If the specified name exists as a literal type other than assumption, or if the probability specification doesn't exactly match an existing assumption this method will throw.

      • addLiteral

        void addLiteral(Literal lit)
         throws PAS.KBException
        Adds an existing literal to this PAS instance. The type of the literal will be handled automatically by the PAS instance.
        Parameters:
        lit -
        Throws:
        PAS.KBException - This method may throw if there's already a literal with the same name but different characteristics.

      • addHornClause

        boolean addHornClause(java.lang.Iterable<? extends Literal> body,
                      Literal head)
               throws PAS.KBException
        Adds the specified horn clause to the PAS instance. The literals used must already be defined.
        Parameters:
        body -
        head -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        PAS.KBException - May throw if the used literals aren't present this PAS instance.

      • addHornClause

        boolean addHornClause(java.lang.String hc)
               throws PAS.KBException
        Parses a given string description for a horn clause and adds it to this PAS instance. The literals used must already be defined.
        Parameters:
        hc -
        Returns:
        Will return true if the PAS instance was modified (ie. the horn clauses wasn't already present), false otherwise.
        Throws:
        PAS.KBException - May throw for various reasons such as parsing problems, or literals not being defined.

      • constructHornClause

        Expressions.Expression<LogicalOps.LogicalOr> constructHornClause(java.lang.String hcDesc)
                                                          throws PAS.KBException
        Constructs the specified horn clause but doesn't add it to the PAS instance, only returns it to the caller. This can be useful for constructing a hypothesis or any other needed propositional expression. This is not a strict horn clause such that we do not require the literals in the body or head to be non-negated.
        Parameters:
        hcDesc -
        Returns:
        The returned value is a clause, but being a horn clause it should preserve its body and head definitions (e.g. not re-order its literals).
        Throws:
        PAS.KBException - May throw for various reasons such as parsing problems, or literals not being defined.

      • constructClause

        Expressions.Expression<LogicalOps.LogicalOr> constructClause(java.lang.String clauseDesc)
                                                      throws PAS.KBException
        Constructs the specified clause using literals defined in the PAS instance, but doesn't add it to the PAS instance. This can be useful for constructing a hypothesis or any other needed propositional expression.
        Parameters:
        clauseDesc -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        PAS.KBException - May throw for various reasons such as parsing problems, or literals not being defined.

      • constructTerm

        Expressions.Expression<LogicalOps.LogicalAnd> constructTerm(java.lang.String termDesc)
                                                     throws PAS.KBException
        Constructs the specified term using literals defined in the PAS instance, but doesn't modify the PAS instance in any way. This can be useful for constructing any needed propositional expression.
        Parameters:
        termDesc -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        PAS.KBException - May throw for various reasons such as parsing problems, or literals not being defined.

      • getFactory

        PropFactory getFactory()
        Return the factory that this PAS instance was created with. It helps avoid passing a factory reference everywhere a PAS instance is given where the receiver may have to create further objects or refer to special objects.
        Returns:
        The PropFactory used to create the PAS instance.
